intro: Halimolobos elatus, commonly known as the sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are usually succulent, adapted to store water and reduce transpiration. Halimolobos elatus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
